trans-unit.source: Connect to a Machine Learning Web Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect to a Machine Learning Web Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: With C# or Python, connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using an authorization key.
trans-unit.target: With C# or Python, connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using an authorization key.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Machine Learning developer experience is a web service API to make predictions from input data in real time or in batch mode.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Machine Learning developer experience is a web service API to make predictions from input data in real time or in batch mode.

trans-unit.source: You use the Azure Machine Learning Studio to create predictions and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service.
trans-unit.target: You use the Azure Machine Learning Studio to create predictions and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service.

trans-unit.source: To learn about how to create and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service using Studio:
trans-unit.target: To learn about how to create and publish an Azure Machine Learning web service using Studio:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish a Machine Learning web service</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish a Machine Learning web service</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Getting Started with ML Studio</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Getting Started with ML Studio</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Preview</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Preview</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Machine Learning Documentation Center</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Machine Learning Documentation Center</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: With the Azure Machine Learning (ML) web service, an external application communicates with an ML workflow scoring model in real time.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure Machine Learning (ML) web service, an external application communicates with an ML workflow scoring model in real time.

trans-unit.source: An ML web service call returns prediction results to an external application.
trans-unit.target: An ML web service call returns prediction results to an external application.

trans-unit.source: To make an ML web service call, you pass an API key which is created when you publish a prediction.
trans-unit.target: To make an ML web service call, you pass an API key which is created when you publish a prediction.

trans-unit.source: The ML web service is based on REST, a popular architecture choice for web programming projects.
trans-unit.target: The ML web service is based on REST, a popular architecture choice for web programming projects.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning has two types of services:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning has two types of services:

trans-unit.source: Request-Response Service (RRS) – A low latency, highly scalable service that provides an interface to the stateless models created and published from the ML Studio.
trans-unit.target: Request-Response Service (RRS) – A low latency, highly scalable service that provides an interface to the stateless models created and published from the ML Studio.

trans-unit.source: Batch Execution Service (BES) – An asynchronous service that scores a batch for data records.
trans-unit.target: Batch Execution Service (BES) – An asynchronous service that scores a batch for data records.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Azure Machine Learning web services, see <linkText>Publish a Machine Learning web service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Azure Machine Learning web services, see <linkText>Publish a Machine Learning web service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You get a web service API key from an ML web service.
trans-unit.target: You get a web service API key from an ML web service.

trans-unit.source: You can get it from Microsoft Azure Machine Learning studio or the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get it from Microsoft Azure Machine Learning studio or the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Azure Machine Learning studio, click WEB SERVICES on the left.
trans-unit.target: In Microsoft Azure Machine Learning studio, click WEB SERVICES on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click a web service.
trans-unit.target: Click a web service.

trans-unit.source: The “API key” is on the DASHBOARD tab.
trans-unit.target: The “API key” is on the DASHBOARD tab.

trans-unit.source: Click MACHINE LEARNING on the left.
trans-unit.target: Click MACHINE LEARNING on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click a workspace.
trans-unit.target: Click a workspace.

trans-unit.source: Click WEB SERVICES.
trans-unit.target: Click WEB SERVICES.

trans-unit.source: Click a web service.
trans-unit.target: Click a web service.

trans-unit.source: Click an endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click an endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The “API KEY” is down at the lower-right.
trans-unit.target: The “API KEY” is down at the lower-right.

trans-unit.source: You can connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using any programming language that supports HTTP request and response.
trans-unit.target: You can connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using any programming language that supports HTTP request and response.

trans-unit.source: You can view examples in C#, Python, and R from an Azure ML web service help page.
trans-unit.target: You can view examples in C#, Python, and R from an Azure ML web service help page.

trans-unit.source: An Azure ML API help page is created when you publish a web service.
trans-unit.target: An Azure ML API help page is created when you publish a web service.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Walkthrough- Publish Web Service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Walkthrough- Publish Web Service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To view an Azure ML API help page In Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: To view an Azure ML API help page In Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: Choose WEB SERVICES.
trans-unit.target: Choose WEB SERVICES.

trans-unit.source: Choose a web service.
trans-unit.target: Choose a web service.

trans-unit.source: Choose API help page - REQUEST/RESPONSE or BATCH EXECUTION.
trans-unit.target: Choose API help page - REQUEST/RESPONSE or BATCH EXECUTION.

trans-unit.source: Azure ML API help page The Azure ML API help page contains details about a prediction web service.
trans-unit.target: Azure ML API help page The Azure ML API help page contains details about a prediction web service.

trans-unit.source: To connect to an Azure ML web service, use an HttpClient passing ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: To connect to an Azure ML web service, use an HttpClient passing ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: You authenticate to the Azure ML service with an API key.
trans-unit.target: You authenticate to the Azure ML service with an API key.

trans-unit.source: To connect to an ML web service, the Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget package must be installed.
trans-unit.target: To connect to an ML web service, the Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget package must be installed.

trans-unit.source: Install Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Install Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Publish the Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset Web Service.
trans-unit.target: Publish the Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset Web Service.

trans-unit.source: Click Tools > Nuget Package Manager > Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: Click Tools > Nuget Package Manager > Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Choose Install-Package Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client.
trans-unit.target: Choose Install-Package Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client.

trans-unit.source: To run the code sample
trans-unit.target: To run the code sample

trans-unit.source: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Azure ML sample collection.
trans-unit.target: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Azure ML sample collection.

trans-unit.source: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.
trans-unit.target: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.

trans-unit.source: See How to get an Azure ML authorization key.
trans-unit.target: See How to get an Azure ML authorization key.

trans-unit.source: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.
trans-unit.target: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.

trans-unit.source: To connect to an Azure ML web service, use the urllib2 library passing ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: To connect to an Azure ML web service, use the urllib2 library passing ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: You authenticate to the Azure ML service with an API key.
trans-unit.target: You authenticate to the Azure ML service with an API key.

trans-unit.source: To run the code sample
trans-unit.target: To run the code sample

trans-unit.source: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Azure ML sample collection.
trans-unit.target: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Azure ML sample collection.

trans-unit.source: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.
trans-unit.target: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.

trans-unit.source: See How to get an Azure ML authorization key.
trans-unit.target: See How to get an Azure ML authorization key.

trans-unit.source: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.
trans-unit.target: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.

trans-unit.source: See How to get a Request URI.
trans-unit.target: See How to get a Request URI.
